noun.description: A part of a monk's or priest's head left bare on top by shaving off the hair.
examples: his hair is thinning up there—soon he'll have a tonsure like a monk's

verb.description: Shave the hair on the crown of.
examples: Louis's half-brothers were tonsured and sent away to monasteries

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin tonsura, from tondere shear, clip.
